title: Removing Large Trees in a Watershed

content.question: A developer wants to develop a large tract of land near a watershed, which will require the removal of several large trees. Which of the following statements best describes the impact that the development would have on the watershed?

choices.label: Removing large trees would decrease the amount of runoff in the watershed.
Removing large trees would cause an increase in temperature and keep the surrounding water and soil warmer.
Removing large trees would decrease the rate of erosion in a watershed.
Removing large trees would increase the retention of water within the watershed.

content.answer: Removing large trees would cause an increase in temperature and keep the surrounding water and soil warmer.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
